articles.title: Preparatory Committee of Korean Nationals Formed in Russia
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee of Korean Nationals Formed in Russia 
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia for celebrating Feb. 16, the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, was formed with due ceremony on January 24.
 The ceremony heard a report and speeches.
 Ju Hui Chol, chairman of the Central Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony.    
 The preparatory committee set a celebration period from February 1 to 20 and decided to hold colorful functions including a meeting to adopt a congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il, a celebration meeting, a lecture, a film show and an art performance in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Visit to China Hailed by Foreign Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Visit to China Hailed by Foreign Figure 
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea (CILRECO), released a statement on Jan. 19 hailing leader Kim Jong Il's unofficial visit to China.
 The statement said that the visit is of very great significance given the situation on the Korean Peninsula that has become tense these days due to the U.S. imperialists' hostile policy toward the DPRK and their persistent obstructions to the independent reunification of Korea and the impact such situation will have on the region and the rest of the world.    
 It further said:    
 The CILRECO notes with high appreciation the facts that both sides gave full assessment of the positive results made at a series of rounds of the Beijing six-party talks and unanimously agreed on the need to consistently maintain the stand to seek a negotiated peaceful solution to the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and continue jointly pushing forward the process of the six-party talks and thus contribute to the final peaceful settlement of the issue.
 The CILRECO hopes that the recent meeting of the top leaders of the DPRK and China will lead to the cooperation between the DPRK and China and provide a right way out to the six-party talks. 
 It hails the successes made by the top leaders of the two countries and calls on all progressive forces of the world to wage a positive international solidarity movement for putting pressure upon the U.S. government.

articles.title: Special Bulletin on DPRK Issued in South Africa
articles.content:
Special Bulletin on DPRK Issued in South Africa 
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People released a special issue of bulletin titled "Mt. Paektu Is the Birthplace of General Kim Jong Il and Spirit of Korea" on Jan. 23 in the run-up to his birthday.
 The bulletin carried articles titled "Rare Leadership Art, Veteran Statesman", "The Leader Who Enjoys Undisputed Support from the People", "Socialist Korea Is Indestructible" "The Korean People Working Miracles," etc.
 Noting that Mt. Paektu is a holy place of the revolution where leader Kim Jong Il was born, the bulletin stressed that socialism in the DPRK is making steady advance despite the imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK because the hearts of all the Korean people are filled with the spirit and mettle of Mt. Paektu.    
 It praised the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il as an example to be followed by all countries and nations of the world aspiring after peace and sovereignty now that the imperialists' persistent high-handed practices are rampant there.

articles.title: January 2006 Issue of "Juche Idea" Published in Japan
Young Koreans Council in U.S. Formed
articles.content:
Young Koreans Council in U.S. Formed 
    Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The Young Koreans Council in the United States reportedly made public its inaugural declaration on Jan. 14.
 Now that the era of national independence and the era of independent reunification have begun the young Koreans in the U.S. have inaugurated the Young Koreans Council in the U.S., an organization of the fresh overseas youth movement, and taken a giant step in response to the call of the times, said the declaration. 
 It stressed the council would make a contribution to achieving independence, democracy and reunification of Korea and the prosperity and development of the country and the nation.    
 The council will work hard to protect the democratic and national rights of the Koreans in the U.S., establish national identity among the Korean community in the U.S. and inherit and develop national culture, the declaration added.
